text: Wesli is the stage name of Wesley Louissaint, a Haitian Canadian musician."Wesli et la valeur de l’exemple en Haïti". RFI Musique, May 15, 2017. He is most noted for winning the Juno Award for World Music Album of the Year at the Juno Awards of 2019 for his album Rapadou Kreyol."Junos 2019: the complete list of winners". CBC Music, March 16, 2019. Born and raised in Port- au-Prince,"Wesli présente «Rapadou»: les trésors des lakous". Le Devoir, July 20, 2018. he moved to Montreal, Quebec in 2001 to study music."N.C. Folk Festival 2018: Wesli, Haitian guitarist". Go Triad, August 30, 2018. He collaborated on albums by Senaya and Sara Rénélik in the 2000s before releasing his own debut album Kouraj in 2009. He followed up with the albums Liberté dans le noir in 2011, ImmiGrand and Ayiti Étoile Nouvelle in 2015,"Dans les îles de Wesli". La Presse, February 7, 2015. an expanded edition of ImmiGrand in 2017, and Rapadou Kreyol in 2018. ==Discography== *Kouraj (2009) *Liberté dans le noir (2011) *ImmiGrand (2015) *Ayiti Étoile Nouvelle (2015) *ImmiGrand Deluxe (2017) *Rapadou Kreyol (2018) ==References== Category:1980 births Category:21st-century Canadian guitarists Category:Black Canadian musicians Category:Canadian world music musicians Category:Musicians from Montreal Category:21st-century Haitian musicians Category:Haitian emigrants to Canada Category:People from Port-au-Prince Category:Living people Category:Juno Award for World Music Album of the Year winners Category:Canadian Folk Music Award winners
title: Wesli
